Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Brevinin-1LTe (B1LTe, natural AMPs, frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a; variants: brevinin-1 analogue 5R)
Sequence Information.Source: skin secretion, the broad-folded frog,Hylarana latouchii

Literature Information.Literature:
Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is highly similar (91.67%) toBrevinin-1LT2L=A=K: 17%; GRAVY: 1.179; M Wt: 2562.259; M formula: C121H205N29O27S2.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC 6538 or MRSA (MIC 1-2 uM), E. faecalis NCTC 
12697 (MIC 2 uM), E. coli ATCC 8739 (MIC 2 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 43816 (MIC 32 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 9027 (MIC 16 uM), A. baumannii ATCC BAA 747 (MIC 4 uM). In addition, it's more potent in eradicating biofilms of Gram+ pathogens than Gram-.Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus; KCl-insensitive:S. aureus; NH4Cl-insensitive:S. aureus; MgCl2-insensitive:S. aureus; CaCl2-insensitive:S. aureus; FeCl3-insensitive:S. aureus; NaCl-sensitive:E. coli; KCl-insensitive:E. coli; NH4Cl-insensitive:E. coli; MgCl2-insensitive:E. coli; CaCl2-sensitive:E. coli; FeCl3-insensitive:E. coli;Toxicity: human RBC: HC50 6.4 uM, highly hemolytic.SAR: incorporation of D-amino acids and arginine increased peptide cell selectivity.
Literature Information.Author: Zou W, Sun R, Yao A, Zhou M, Chen X, Ma C, Wang T, Jiang Y, Chen T, Shaw C, Wang L. 2023
Literature Information.Reference: Comput Struct Biotechnol J. 2023 Nov 19;21:5719-5737. doi: 10.1016/j.csbj.2023.11.031.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: A promising antibiotic candidate, brevinin-1 analogue 5R, against drug-resistant bacteria, with insights into its membrane-targeting mechanism
